comments: Expensive, but best keyboard I've ever used in my life. If this explodes on me, I might get the Azoth extreme edition.
I love this keyboard for all it has. I didn't need the screen, but it's nice. But I'm just a way bigger fan of low profile keyboards.

Bought on sale ($199.99) and it's well worth the premium.
Battery life is stellar, albeit I turn off the OLED screen and keep the RGB at 25%...
You get the custom/enthusiast keyboard quality without all the guess work. I installed ROG Crate on a burner PC to save custom RGB settings on it, so I can't speak of software issues.
The lack of a wrist board/pad is the only con, especially for the price (sale or not). It'd be nice to have a magnetic pad, but knowing ASUS/ROG, they'd charge a limb (or two) for it.

This is actually my on-the-go keyboard, but since it's so nice feeling it's now sitting next to my desktop, until I figure out how to sound mod a Wooting Two HE etc for this purpose.
I was looking for a quiet yet nice feeling wireless keyboard, and the Azoth ticks many boxes with its unique mix of gaming and enthusiast features even out-of-the-box. With the dampening and default switches, it already feels and sounds much cleaner and crisper than a typical gaming keyboard, like my somewhat mushy and pingy Corsair Strafe with MX Silent. Paired with a silent switch like Bobagum/Lucy, and it becomes basically silent. The wireless capability on the Azoth is next to none, with super low latency and super long battery life (one reason why I picked instead of another Keychron Q Pro. Another is the weight). While not as good as a Wooting with analog / custom actuation / rapid trigger, the switch is fairly decent for general gaming.
The main issue is that the volume "toggle" is horrendous compared to a regular knob. It wobbles a lot, is very easy to misclick to mute, and difficult to adjust to the proper volume level. The gasket mount is also stiffer than I expected, another area where the Keychron Q Pro does better. I have no issues so far with the Armory Crate software, but that one certainly also got a lot of complaints on the Internet. And of course, especially for some game genres, no doubt the Wootings remain superior. Still - as far as wireless gaming or out-of-the-box feel/sound goes, the Azoth is a great option. 4/5 for the terrible volume "toggle".

name: Cooler Master SK620 RGB Wired Gaming Keyboard

specs.Part #:
SK-620-GKTL1-US
SK-620-GKTL1-DE
SK-620-GKTL1-FR

SK-620-GKTL1-UK
SK-620-GKTL1-RU

name: Keychron C2 Wired Standard Keyboard
comments: Sounds great and looks very plain, which I prefer over a super flashy design. Also nice having a ton of keys to work with. I'm not a keyboard person but it's been working very well and the keys sound nice and clacky. My only problem is that you can't use the function and multimedia keys at the same time afaik. This wouldn't be a big deal normally, except that a lot of software for 3D modeling, video editing, etc uses the function keys. This makes things pretty inconvenient sometimes, but not too often. Still enough of a problem to bring the rating to 4 stars though...
Awesome starter keyboard, especially as a base for future customization (as long as you like full sized keyboards)!

The gateron pro switches come pre-lubed. Brown switches are just as quiet maybe more so than my cherry reds, was really expecting them to sound in-between reds and blues but they're pretty silent.
I was worried that the keycaps would be cheap plastic since they're ABS but surprisingly they have a nice texture to them and don't feel flimsy, cheap or greasy/slick at all, not even going to replace them with PBT like i had planned.
For the cons: There's a very dim permanent backlight on as far as I can tell, it has a glow in the dark feel to it. And the led indicator for windows/mac toggle is always on which is just a personal gripe.
Overall the quality feels really high for a $55 keyboard, solid keycaps, hot swappable 3-5 pin, can even go with optical switches. The pre-lubed brown switches are nice and silent, only sound is a solid thock from the larger keys such as spacebar and backspace, that could just be how hard I am hitting them though. Also comes with a usb-c to usb-c cable, with a usb-a adapter for one end.
Highly recommend this as a solid starter base or just pick it up and leave it as is if you're looking for a solid wired mechanical keyboard. If you want a wireless/bluethooth base look at RK ROYAL KLUDGE RK98 but would keep in mind the cheap Outemu default switches should be swapped out immediately on that board.

name: Corsair K70 PRO MINI RGB Wireless/Wired/Bluetooth Mini Keyboard
comments: Great RGB and connections. will be returning this, need a bigger keyboard.

I really like this keyboard. I like all of the options with all of the LED lights on it.
The keys aren’t too easy to press which I prefer because I find myself miss typing constantly with my previous keyboard that had keys that took almost nothing to press.

name: Corsair K70 CORE TKL RGB Wired Gaming Keyboard
Razer Huntsman Mini RGB Wired Mini Keyboard
comments: I have had this keyboard for a bit over two years now and have had no problems. I have the linear switches which I am mostly happy with. A few months after buying it I replaced all the outside keys (minus 1-9, 0, -, and +) with a pink keycap set from Razer. It goes well with my League Star Guardians Kai'Sa and Akali mouse mat :)

it's small and it looks nice, but apart from that, switching from a very cheap membrane keyboard it's pretty hard to get used to and I find myself hitting backspace a lot, no hardware issues though and lights look nice with pudding keycaps

Luckily got this through a huge sale I found and the linear switches feel very smooth, I love the full white keyboard look and the RGB isn't overpowering nor underwhelming. Ticked off a star solely cause upon the first days of trying it out a couple keys like the semicolon and backspace would get stuck after being pressed, but it hasn't happened again so far.

name: Corsair K70 RGB MK.2 Wired Gaming Keyboard
comments: rocking a k65 myself, always loved corsair boards.

I'm a little torn on this one. It's definitely got some nice qualities, like the RGB, the metal frame, and the media controls. On the other hand, I think the ergonomics could be a little better... maybe it's personal preference, but I wish the wrist rest was soft and didn't taper down. Also, it's big, which means you'll never be missing a key, but then it takes up a lot of space. I feel like it's a good gaming keyboard, but not the best mechanical keyboard, if that makes any sense? It's got all the "gaming" features but it misses a lot of things that the wider enthusiast mechanical keyboard market has, like hot-swappable switches and a detachable cable. Overall, though, it's still a solid keyboard with a fair bit going for it.

If You want a great looking keyboard - look no further. If You want just a mechanical keyboard - there are plenty of cheaper propositions on the market. One thing that could be frustrating- Some games (Ubisoft especially) use custom color profiles that overwrite Your defaut one. I think it is possible to disable but im not 100% sure.
After 15 months "R" led starded changing colors after pressing it. During the RMA process Corsair sent to me a completely new keyboard. So maybe good customer support is worth a bit higher MSRP.
Feels amazing to use, has nice RGB programming options, and the brown cherry switches are tactile and quiet - good for roommates!
Replaced my old STRAFE, feels more satisfying to type on due to its build quality (aluminium compared to plastic) and good RGB lighting. iCUE software also pretty simple to use as well.
Its a great keyboard, and the RGB software is nice and easy to work. Only problem I had is I could never seem to find a TKL version :(
$60 refurbished from Newegg- Great feel for gaming but when using as an actual keyboard can feel a little bulky. RGB looks great too.
Its a good keyboard. Nice lighting and icue but pcb broke after 8 months or so of use and forced to change keyboard

name: Logitech G710 Plus Wired Gaming Keyboard
comments: I have owned this keyboard for about 10 years I think, and it works amazingly. I've never had a problem with it. The USB port on the keyboard makes for a very convenient temporary connection point for tablets and other devices. The G keys are very helpful and probably have saved me dozens of hours with repetitious tasks. The G keys can also be locked so you don't accidentally press them and spam commands in chat. The fact the keyboard doesn't have multiple colors is one of my favorite aspects. Just backlight with white. Additionally, the brightness is adjustable. The volume wheel is very fun to use. The build quality is tremendous. I have moved 6 times with this keyboard. I take it with me to work sometimes to clean it. I have gotten very used to the Cherry MX brown switches on the keyboard, and I purchased this keyboard because it was one of the quiet options I could find to avoid disturbing my ex-wife while she slept but I will try something with a more tactile response in the future. All around have no reason to buy another keyboard until this craps out, and when it does I'll be trying to find something very similar to it.
Mom bought it for me for Christmas and apparently Mr. Tech Tips himself still uses one of these at work? So that's cool I guess
Had this for 5 years or so. Great keyboard no need to upgrade until it dies.
Love g710+
Bought this thing a little after I built my PC. The keyboard itself is great, but I’d like to eventually swap it out for a Das Keyboard 4 Pro. It’s got brown switches if anyone is wondering.
Had this keyboard for a while. I prefer the feedback and quietness from the MX Browns with the O-rings around each key. The volume adjuster is really neat.
Got this from a friend, great mechanical keyboard that doesn't make too much noise. Only complaint is the high keys
Absolutely blew me away. This keyboard is amazing! The 6 macros on the side are really helpful for gaming and work (if you don't have time to remember those shortcuts)alike!
I've had this for 5 years and it's going strong, the keyboard is a trooper and a dream to type on. The orange on the side was gross so I painted it white.
Snagged from walmart awhile ago since they went on sale for like 49 and $3 warranty. I really like the volume wheel thingy.

name: Logitech MK120 Wired Slim Keyboard With Optical Mouse

specs.Features:
Comfortable, quiet typing
Spill-resistant design
High-definition optical tracking: 1000 dpi
Thin profile
Durable keys
Plug-and-play USB connections
Easy-to-read keys
Sturdy, adjustable tilt legs
Curved space bar

comments: It’s cheap, that’s about it
Works amazing for 20 bucks. Feels good enough for me, the keys aren't sticky and the mouse it comes with works good too.
Cheap keyboard and mouse. Not to noisy and not too fancy. Ended up only using the keyboard though since I found an old wireless mouse I had.
Been using them for 5 years from my previous build and no issues at all. Cables are long enough but I wish they were even longer. I still prefer them to wireless, it's just more reliable.
Good
After nearly 5 years I've already stopped using the mouse but the keyboard is very excellent and I still use it. It's hard to clean though.
If you are looking for an inexpensive keyboard/mouse combination, then I would recommend this to anyone! It is a great membrane keyboard for practically nothing!
Keyboard and mouse combo that lets you type and click.
Great value
Cheap, but is comfortable and does its job flawlessly.

name: Asus ROG Falchion RX RGB Wireless/Bluetooth/Wired Slim Keyboard
Logitech K400 Plus Wireless Mini Keyboard With Touchpad
comments:
Has a short range.
People say the trackpad isn’t great, but I think it is, keyboards good too.
I wish it was backlit.
Hey, please don't try and type on this thing! Use it on your HTPC or for setting up a new PC but don't ever expect to be productive with it.
Hey its cheap and always there to jab a key on the htpc or test bench. Just don't try to type on it.
trackpad will randomly click when scrolling
Very cheap. Works great though. Takes a couple AA batteries and is good for 6-12 months at a time. 5 stars for Logi :D

Bought this as a spare wireless option for the rare times when I bring my PC into the living room for better roomscale VR, just because I need something wireless to control my PC with it. Works flawlessly for the purpose, though the trackpad isn't the most pleasant.

This keyboard is alright. The trackpad was barely usable in Linux, lots of phantom movements. In Windows 10 it is better, but still not great. The keyboard is nice to type on though, and the batteries last forever. For the price, it's pretty good.
Not particularly built well, trackpad is mediocre at best, and keys are pretty smushed. I love it. I use it almost like a TV remote from bed. It's cheap and fills my need perfectly.

Just perfect for HTPC use from the bed or the couch. Impossible to lose. Battery life for months. Takes multiple drops from bed/couch height like a champ. I prefer the original k400, but these pluses work very well too.

Best couch keyboard ever. Doesn't feel cheap and the range is far more than I need. I mean I can co out on my back porch and it still works at that range. The extra left click button on the top left is nice so I can basically hold it like a game controller with my right thumb on the touchpad and left thumb on the left click. I had that keyboard for over a year now and it is still rocking the original pair of AA batteries it came shipped with.

name: Keychron Q6 HE QMK RGB Wired/Wireless/Bluetooth Standard Keyboard
SteelSeries Apex 100 Wired Gaming Keyboard
comments: Im surprised its still working for how cheap it was

Tappity Tappity, this thing is a snippy, responsive Keyboard if I've ever had one. The lights are nice, not too bright and I don't need rainbows, so I'm happy with this thing, particularly for it's price. 10/10.
amazing budget keyboard. It only has blue LED's, so not much custiomization in the RGB department

name: Logitech G213 RGB Wired Gaming Keyboard
comments: It's too bad that the little clamps on the back of it break so easily. I hit the table hard once, and the RGB has been all over the place since then.
Solid keyboard for what I paid. Nothing bad to say, but nothing really worth mentioning.

name: AmazonBasics KU-0833 +MSU0939 Wired Standard Keyboard With Optical Mouse
comments: It’s actually a decent mouse and keyboard combo for only $15. My brother’s wanting to use an Xbox controller for most games he plays so he just needed something to get to those games. Keyboard quality feels nice actually while the mouse feels a little low quality.
Standard mouse and keyboard combo. Good enough aesthetic feel, durability, and travel distance. Nothing fancy here at all, but it gets the job done on a budget.
Very poorly build. Mouse is small. Keyboard is awkward. The both freeze up and lag a ton. Don't buy!

name: Redragon K512 SHIVA RGB Wired Gaming Keyboard
comments: Don't like the click clack of keys so I went with a cheap membrane keyboard. Besides I had a budget so can't complain.

name: Logitech PRO X RAPID RGB Wired Gaming Keyboard
Logitech G710 Wired Gaming Keyboard
comments: I prefer white LEDs and annoying my friends in voice chat, but kinda miss my MX Browns after being on MX Blues for a while.
This baby held itself together through abuse. From water spilling on it to being smashed, it served me well until it was time to retire it.
I love this keyboard.

Absolutely love this keyboard. Stumbled into it for $40 a couple of years ago. It had a minor nick on the corner of the keyboard which is why it was discounted. Couldn't be happier with it. It's immensely satisfying to type on with the cherry switches. It's awesome for gaming. The only thing I would change about it would be that I wish it was RGB so I could play around with the lighting on it. That's a very minor gripe though, this keyboard is perfect outside of that. I am planning a new build in the nearer future and I think I'll probably still use this keyboard because I love it so much.

This is my first mechanical keyboard and its great .The keys are responsive, the build quality is definitely above average though not as high as some of the keyboards in its price range. NO RGB but that doesn't really bother me. The lighting is also non uniform for some of the larger keys but at least the white LEDs are actually white and not the pinkish, greenish or yellowish white that you get with most RGB keyboards. Only the 6 G-keys can be reassigned which isn't on par with some other keybaords that allow remapping of all keys. It feels like it's going to last a very long time. I ended up buying damper rings to reduce the noise of the keyboard because the blue switches are fairly loud. I will probably replace this Keyboard with a Razer Blackwidow Chroma V2 because it has a much nicer wrist rest.
Was actually gifted to me from a friend. This keyboard is backlit, no RGB or anything. No complaints, the keys are a little loud but thats what you get these keys.

Great feeling but pretty loud.
Fun story, I also have a friend who has the same keyboard. This keyboard is apparently loud enough to irritate his dog. Everytime he presses a key, his dog will bark at the keyboard, LMAO

Once you go clack, you never go back! Also, once 18 custom macros for all your lenny needs. 4 levels of backlighting and you can choose to have wasd and the arrow keys lit separately! The volume wheel is a nice bonus, I love not having to go to settings to change the volume of a game!

This is my first mechanical keyboard and its great .The keys are responsive, the build quality is definitely above average though not as high as some of the keyboards in its price range. NO RGB but that doesn't really bother me. The lighting is also non uniform for some of the larger keys but at least the white LEDs are actually white and not the pinkish, greenish or yellowish white that you get with most RGB keyboards. Only the 6 G-keys can be reassigned which isn't on par with some other keybaords that allow remapping of all keys but I'm still trying to think of macros to assign for the G-keys. It feels like it's going to last a very long time

A bit over the top "gamer" looking, but it matches well with my Logitech G430 headset, and the cherry MX blue switches are absolutely wonderful and I love typing and gaming on them. I got this for a steal on Black Friday, but I would go with something from corsair or otherwise if I were buying at full price. I do like the volume roller and media keys on this keyboard though. Feels top notch and a drastic improvement from the scissor switches my laptop used.

name: Razer BlackWidow V3 RGB Wired Gaming Keyboard
comments: Click click clack click clack. On the microphone it sounds like eating something crunchy. It is so sensitive that even a wrong look at a key causes a typo. But seriously, just buy Razer keyboards.
Great keyboard. Have issue with Razer. (See mouse below)

I love this keyboard to the moon and back. The keys are very clicky and make a lotta noise when typing but thats the only thing that I could see people not buying this keyboard. Me personally I love the clickiness of it as well as the Razer chroma feature which brings my setup to the next level.

name: E-element Z88RGB81WRZ Wired Mini Keyboard
comments: Love this keyboard. The description doesn’t list it, but the keyboard also comes in black and with different keys and can also have different switches, such as reds and browns for quieter clicks. The argb is wonderful and has many options to explore. I also like how it does not take up much space due to it being tenkeyless.
I love this little keyboard, saves me space on the desk. There's a handful of lighting presets to play around with. The feedback on the keys feel very good.

Great keyboard! RGB is awesome and the cord is nice and long so it can reach the USB hub under my desk. The only thing that is different is that I got the red switch variant which is still very good. Blues are way too loud for me.

name: Tecware Phantom RGB Wired Gaming Keyboard
comments: Awesome keyboard, one of the best at its price points for sure. Super easy to swap out switches too, but the stock ones are great anyways.
Very nice keyboard. My only problem is that the switches on my most used keys will start to fail after a few months, but that might just be a problem with me.
Fantastic board for the price. Ringing noise when the key bottoms out will take a star off. RGB is easy to control and looks awesome.
its decent, software is not total garbage either

Only had for a week, but its awesome, the RGB lighting and customization are super good, and the switches come pre lubed as well. with some HyperX pudding keycaps this things is a ******* paperweight.

Very good mechanical keyboard for the price, feels solid due to partly metal construction. Keys do have a bit of pinging when released but doesn't affect performance and can't be heard when wearing headphones.

Surprisingly heavy. I don't have a comparison because I came from scissor switches. Not blues because who the hell uses blues. Seems pretty high quality for the price ? One thing I'd say is that I have sweaty hands and that does begin to show up on the keycaps real quick
had this keyboard for a while in brown switches, the only complaint i have is that the stabilizers becomes early after a while but the rgb looks good

got this keyboard in the red switch variant, so glad the other keyboard i was going to get was out of stock this board feels amazing, its not huge as it is TKL, the RGB is also amazing, awaiting a set of pudding keycaps to truly accent to RGB heaven
Feels really solid. The red switches feels really good as well. And the RGB effects looks really good.

name: HP HyperX Alloy Origins 60 RGB Gaming Keyboard
Corsair K55 CORE RGB RGB Wired Gaming Keyboard
comments: Easy to customise, nice feeling to the keys. Full size, couldn't be happier

name: Verbatim 70734 Wired Standard Keyboard With Laser Mouse
Corsair K55 CORE RGB RGB Wired Gaming Keyboard
Corsair K100 RGB Wired Gaming Keyboard
comments: loved it and super cool
Very good looking, the keys feel great, and the switches work well. The handrest cushion is above-average quality. Definitely overpriced as most Corsair products tend to be.

name: Wooting One RGB Wired Gaming Keyboard
comments: Fun concept, but not very practical in action. Though a great feeling keyboard with some advanced functionality, with even more to come!

name: Corsair K70 CORE TKL RGB Bluetooth/Wireless/Wired Gaming Keyboard
Logitech MX KEYS S Wireless/Wired/Bluetooth Standard Keyboard
SteelSeries Apex Pro Mini Wireless RGB Bluetooth/Wireless Gaming Keyboard
HP HyperX Alloy Origins RGB Wired Gaming Keyboard
comments:
For the price theres better boards,but a nice "gaming" keyboard,would still get something from akko or keychron rather than it,but didn't know those exist at the time I bought this.
The software is coinflip,its great one day then the next you wanna rip your hair out.

After 6 months of use, the space bar has picked up a wobble, and the "killer app" USB C has gotten more common. It's still an ok keyboard and the control software has been fine, but there are better options on the market now.
Awesome board, great quality for a solid gaming/work keyboard

Great to type on, great to game on, lighting profiles are easy to use and convenient to have.
Definitely recommend getting the gel wrist rest with it as well. Gets you hands at a comfortable level to the keyboard.
